html:
** Amazon.com Inc's stock AMZN.O up 0.8% on Fri, with its peak for the session surpassing its July record closing high and nearing its intraday record as Austria reimposed a lockdown to curb the spread of COVID-19 in Europe

** Stock last at $3,742.41, just above July 8 record high close of $3.731.41

** A resurgence in COVID-19 cases saw Austria reimpose a lockdown, and fears that Germany could follow suit rattled stock markets globally (Full Story)

** Amazon was a massive winner last year when COVID lockdowns forced consumers around the world to shop on line but the stock has underperformed in 2021 with the online retailer facing a tougher outlook as consumers ventured outside again

** With Fri's gain, AMZN up 14% YTD, vs Nasdaq's .IXIC 25% rise

** Still, stock is trading around 73x earnings expected over next 12 months, vs 5-yr average of 86x, per Refinitiv Datastream

** 57 analysts cover AMZN, on avg rating it 'buy'. Its median PT is $4,000, which is 7% above its current price

** AMZN is ranked 6 among S&P 500 stocks by how highly recommended they are by analysts


(Reporting by Noel Randewich)

(( noel.randewich@tr.com ; Twitter: https://twitter.com/randewich; ))
